'''Orcobal''' was the ''"champion of the [[Orcs]]"'' that was slain by [[Ecthelion]] in [[Gondolin]].<ref>{{LT2|Index}}, entry "Orcobal"</ref>

== History ==
During the [[Fall of Gondolin]], Orcobal was the champion of those Orcs which assailed the [[Gondothlim]] alongside the [[Balrogs]] at the coming of the [[Dragons|Drakes]]. Orcobal was ultimately slain by Ecthelion of the Fountain, who, after killing two goblin captains, ''"cleft the head of Orcobal their chiefest champion to his teeth"'' before the gates of [[Gondolin]].<ref name="LT2Gondolin">{{LT2|III}}, p. 181</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Orcobal'' is clearly [[Gnomish]], but it is not glossed.

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
Orcobal never appeared within any of Tolkien's writing after "[[The Fall of Gondolin (chapter)|The Fall of Gondolin]]" in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.
